comment.body: Looks like the stats counter is broken, working on the fix...
It's fixed in Rev3102, thanks again for reporting.
For me the git repo sites (eg.: 1GTispUAh7VLQjLAkKCUmnpJA7jU6K7Grh) are not loading. (looks like nobody has the content.json file) Can you sign and publish them again?
Changing the address is possible, but the permissions are recorded to site's address not to the domain.
Yeah, I will check it soon

Looks like there is some problem with size calculation for sites larger than 10MB (you have to change the limit to 30MB+ manually to finish the download), but once it finished downloading it's working fast and fine, grats!
(I will try to fix the size calc error tomorrow)
Yes, nice discovery! :)

I changed to link, because I need the sidebar for information and signing.

@Sirenyc: Please update to latest revision. There was a problem that affected sites larger than 10MB, but it's fixed now.

@Krixano: using different address for sidebar is a good idea I will restore the redirect.
I just tried to pack the repository with `git repack --max-pack-size 1m`. It's a bit slower this way, maybe a read cache could help to avoid re-reading big files using fileGet. 
The bigger files also triggered an error when reading files from different sites at the same time. (already fixed, but need some more testing, will roll out tomorrow) 
Btw. why does it needs to read ZeroID site?

@Glightstar: Just fixed it in rev3157, please update and try again
@Git Center: For big files probably ajax would the best as it transfers the files asnyc from websocket, support ranged queries and don't have to pack/unpack base64.
The feedQuery API call tries to parse the query, add some optimization (date_added > now -3 days) and ORDER BY date_added DESC LIMIT 10 and it does not support  sub-queries with union atm.
Not sure, what happens when you press the Sign button on the sidebar?
Have you signed your main site before?
@Git Center: site.storage.getPath does not allows ".." in the file path, but if you find any security issue please report it. (preferably a private way)
@Git Center: Yeah, it will, so you can use it to store some private data, but it's not recommended because it won't work well in multi-user environments.

@Git Center: Oh I thought it's just for cache or other meaningless data. Well then, think the best solution is create a random id, store using UserSetSettings and write it to that directory/file. This way it's also multi-user compatible.
When/where do you see that error?
Thanks for reporting fixed in Rev3729. The problem was with the win-style data_dir configuration value. (I think it also affected earlier versions of ZeroNet)
We could have a "Recently added" section for sites that were added and successfully downloaded in last X days
I have added a "RECENTLY DOWNLOADED" section to the ZeroHello (lists pages that finished downloading in last 3 days)

@leftside: The problem is in the markdown syntax parser. (you have to use `[title](link)` format, so the last `)` is problematic) Maybe it could include a feature and detect if there is a `(` in the link, then the closing `))` should consider as part of an url.
Do you mean this one: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroHello/issues/115 ? I still can't reproduce it.
There was no change. Do you see the checked "Follow in newsfeed" in the posts's 3dot menu? Also: are you using py3 or py2 version?

@leftside:  Do you see the checked "Follow in newsfeed" in the posts's 3dot menu? (should be visible after hovering cursor to the topright corner of the post)
At ZeroHello if you press the "from X site in Xms" text, does it have a "	ZeroMe Post follow" section?
I have modified the ZeroHello and added the db error to the stats section. What message do you see bellow that line that ha n/a for exectution time?
Thanks, I was able to reproduce it, fix is on the way. :)
Should be fixed in rev3864, please confirm if it's working after the update
In tor always mode every connection is made using the tor proxy, so local connections will not work.
Yeah searching in files tab is only supported in py3 version.
